title: Seeded rye crackers
time: Hands-on time 10 min, oven time 10 min
description: Whether dunking in hummus or using for cheese, this rye cracker recipe is so quick and simple you’ll be whipping up a batch whenever you fancy.
ingredients: 150g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
4 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, plus extra to brush
Fennel, nigella, sesame, caraway or poppy seeds, and sea salt for the topping

method.Step 1: Combine the flours with the salt in a bowl. Make a well in the centre, add the olive oil and 140ml water, then use your hands to form a dough (you may need a drop more water).

method.Step 2: Tip the dough out onto a floured work surface and knead briefly to combine, then cut pieces smaller than your palm and roll out, using a floured rolling pin, as thin as you can. They can be different sizes but don’t make them too big. Heat the oven to 200°C/180°C fan/gas 6 and put in 2 baking sheets to heat up (you may need to bake in batches).

method.Step 3: Brush the dough with a little oil, sprinkle with your choice of seeds and a little sea salt. Roll the topping into the dough. Bake on the sheets for 5-10 minutes until golden. Watch them, as cooking time will depend on their thickness. Cool completely on a wire rack and break up to serve.
